questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
A company's sales staff wants a simplified way to manage their opportunities in Dynamics 365 Sales without adding custom code.
You need to provide a solution for each requirement.
Which solutions should you provide? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content: I don't understand why there are so many Dynamics questions when there is no mention of Dynamics in the PL200 'Skills Measured' document..?

comments.content: also one of my frustrations...
There is no path for D365 devs, because D365 is a part of the Power Platform stack. It is a model-driven app in the end.
the real exam, dynamics questions still appear
Vico93 meant the administrators of examtopics or in the real exam?

Because this exam used to be called MB-200 (Exam MB-200: Microsoft Power Platform + Dynamics 365 Core) and changed to PL-200 without Dynamics but the administrators didn't make care to remove the questions
i agree
However the requirement says "...in a standard view"a and charts are added to forms so to be strict it does not satisfy the requirement
THe joys of MS exams.. Sometimes the technicalities matter, sometimes not..

discussion.content: Chart should be correct for last question as list view cannot show aggregates

list entity is Display name: Marketing list. 'List view' the view of the marketing list?
most probably they meant to say the view (userquery). most probably chart because by stage. 
but if you have more than 5000 opportunites this doesn't work :-(. Kanban, maybe it is standard. 
Kanban or Chart. i go for chart.

comments.content: simplified. chart is simpler than kanban (some users you need to explain what kanban is because they have never ever heard of it). kanban is not supported in the mobile app --> not simple?! number by stage does not the view itself.

discussion.content: Last one should be Kanban. Because it gives you a count of the records and can be configured to sort by stage

1) Correct
2) You can't add two controls to a single view, just checked. The correct answer should be "Add one control to MY Opportunity and a custom view"
3) Charts is correct

On Exam, March 2023
Selected
1) Kanban
2) My Opportunities
3) Chart Pane

comments.content:
Though chart might make more sense here since it's asking for a number to be visible adding the total number of open opportunities by stage.
My selections:
1, 2, 4
Add a Kanban control, Add both controls to My Opportunities View, Use the Chart pane on the view

discussion.content:
I think the given answers are correct:
1. Drag and drop opportunities to change the stage
** This is Add a Kanban Control
Reference: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365-release-plan/2020wave1/dynamics365-sales/work-opportunities-kanban-view 

2. Show each salesperson their opportunities in Calendar and Kanban View
** Add both controls to the My Opportunities view
Note: You can enable Kanban and Calendar views for any entity
Reference: https://ahaapps.com/kanban-and-calendar-view-for-activities-in-dynamics-365-crm/

3. Show each salesperson the number of open opportunities by stage in a standard view
** This can be done through a list view
Note: The wording 'simplified' and 'standard' seem important here for deciding between a list view and a chart pane. With a view, you'll be able to see all open opportunities and sort by stage
This question was NOT part of the exam in Aug 2022

Based on all discussion threads I have gone with
a: Kanban control - (Does it well)
b: Add one control to My Opportunities and a custom view (only one control) (only one control per view when directly added)
c: List view (can sort by stage - does not allow chart or Kanban)

I would recommend the answer is:
Add a Kanban control
Add both controls to the My Opportunities view
List view 
Chart are view based so the view would be logical

I believe that in the third question Kanaban and Chart Pane are both valid. 
Could anyone explain to me if I am wrong. I have tried and I am able to see the number of the opportunities in a specific stage at the top of each Kanaban column (a column for each stage). So why is Kanaban wrong?

Add Both Controls to My Opportunities view won't work, I have tried it, you can only add one control per view, so a second custom view needs to be defined from a copy of My Opportunities view to add the calendar.

comments.content: You can add multiple controls to all vies from the entity settings but you can only add one control if you going to a specific view. in this case i think that it should be My opportunities and a custom view

I don't think you are correct.
You can add multiple controls to a view.

I think the answer is:
Add a Kanban control
Add both controls to the My Opportunities view
Either List view or Chart. This one I'm not sure on. But the standard Kanban view does include aggregations.

For each view, you can select with experienced is utilized (e.g. web, phone or table).
When using the application, the user has the ability to switch which control is used by using the "Show As" button on the toolbar.

In essence, you can have two controls on a singular view.

discussion.content:
a: Kanban control
b: Add one control to My Opportunities and a custom view (only one control)
c: Kanban will do the job easily and chart pane is also an option (you need to setup a chart by Opportunity, aggregation count all and add an horizontal axis on pipeline phase). I would say also Kanban that provides exactly the wanted result

comments.content: I revise my answer for C, as it is mentioned standard view, the chart pane would be a better answer (even if the Kanban could be easily added to a standard view, that would results a customized view and not standard anymore, well this ambiguous)

discussion.content:
Add a Kanban control, 
Add both controls to the My Opportunities view, 
Use the chart pane.
Add a Kanban control, Add both controls to the My Opportunities view, Use the chart pane.

Answer Question 2 "Add both controls to My Opportunities view" seems to be not correct. When we try to do that we get an error message "you can not add two custom controls on a view". So we assume Answer 4 is correct

comments.content: Turbotopo is pretty right, i've tried myself and it works, the truth is that you can't use them combined, in the same time, but you are able to switch to the needed control
you can add both to the view. https://www.ahaapps.com/kanban-and-calendar-view-for-activities-in-dynamics-365-crm/

questions.answer_description:
Box 1: Add a Kanban control.
The Kanban view allows your sales team to move opportunities from one stage to another by simply dragging them.
Box 2: Add both controls to the My Opportunities view.
✑ Kanban views help salespeople to manage their opportunities and activities effectively. Add the Kanban control to the Opportunity and Activity entity so salespeople can use the Kanban views.
The Kanban control works only on the Opportunity and Activity entities.
✑ If you use unified interface, you can display any record in a calendar view via the calendar control.
- Go to Settings->Customization->Customize the System
- Open the configuration for the entity that you want to use the calendar control (Opportunities in our example)
- Click the View tab
- Click ג€Add Controlג€ and select the calendar control.
- Click the dot for every interface from which you want the calendar control to be available.

Box 3: Use a List view -
opportunities in Dynamics 365 Sales
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365-release-plan/2020wave1/dynamics365-sales/work-opportunities-kanban-view https://crmtipoftheday.com/1206/view-any-dynamics-365-record-on-a-calendar/ https://fivep.com.au/how-to-get-visibility-and-report-on-an-opportunities-active-current-sales-stage-without-code-microsoft-dynamics-365/

discussion.content: Took the exam in August 2022. This question was there.
This question was part of the exam in Aug 2022

questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
You administer the Microsoft 365 and Power Platform environments for Contoso, Ltd. The company has a model-driven app that is used to track customer interactions with employees. The app uses standard table types for customers. A user named Elisabeth Rice signs in to the app by using the following sign in name: Elisabeth.Rice@contoso.com.
After marriage, Elisabeth changes her legal name to Elisabeth Mueller.
You need to update the sign in name for the user without losing any application history.
Solution: From Dynamics 365 Settings, select Email Configuration. In the active mailbox for the user, update the name.
Does the solution meet the goal?

You plan to implement Microsoft Dataverse.
You must track changes for two columns in the Account table. You must maintain a historical log of changes for the two columns and track only what is necessary.
You configure the appropriate organization settings.
You need to configure the system to track changes for the two columns.
Which two actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content: Just giving back to the community. This appeared on 3/18/2022 exam. Correct answer
Change tracking is used to maintain information on what has changed in a table to synchronize with an external system. For columns and table only auditing can be enabled. So , AB is correct.

Selected Answer: AB
A & B is the only option
This question was NOT part of the exam in Aug 2022

Just passed with 791.
Selected
A. Enable auditing for the Account table.
B. Enable auditing for the two specific columns

Selected Answer: AB
Correct Answer, change tracking is for portal cache

Selected Answer: AB
on exam 10 Dec 2021. Pass with 870 marks.

choices.A: Enable auditing for the Account table.
choices.B: Enable auditing for the two specific columns.
choices.C: Enable change tracking for the Account table.
choices.D: Enable change tracking for the two specific columns.

questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
On a Contact record, a user creates a Note record that contains the word running.
One week later, the user reports that they cannot find the Contact record associated with the Note record.
You need to find the Note record.
Solution: Use Categorized Search to search for the word run.
Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content: Chief Renaming Officer changed this to 'Dataverse Search' now lol

Selected Answer: B
Categorized search = quick find
Relevance search = Dataverse search

comments.content: Nope, I was mistaken. No is correct!

discussion.content:
For me A seems like the right answer:

With categorized search, you can search for rows that begin with a specific word or use a wildcard character.

Begins with: Results include rows that begin with a specific word. For example, if you want to search for "Alpine Ski House," type alp in the search box; if you type ski, the row won't show up.
Wildcard: For example, *ski or *ski*

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-apps/user/quick-find

comments.content:
Forget it. I missed that it's a NOTE field that "contains" the word
Answer is B

discussion.content: Categorized search is a quick find that works across multiple tables. It also works with "begins with", so searching on "run" should work as far as I can tell.

This question was on Sept 24th
Scored 712
Selected: B
This question was NOT part of the exam in Aug 2022
Relevance search is not available anymore its Dataverse search now! Could you please update the latest questions!!!!

Just passed with 791.
Selected B. No

Selected Answer: B
Just giving back to the community. This appeared on 3/18/2022 exam. Correct answer
on exam 10 Dec 2021. Pass with 870 marks.

comments.content: How many questions were there from this set ?
clicked wrong Question :-( please remove

relevance search: Search across documents in Microsoft Dataverse: Includes search results for text in documents that are stored in Dataverse such as PDF, Microsoft Office documents, HTML, XML, ZIP, EML, plain text, and JSON file formats. It also searches text in notes and attachments.
quick find only find data in a column.

discussion.content:
It's now called 'Dataverse search'. 

BTW: Why is Categorized (Quick Find) not an o.k. awnser?
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powerapps/user/search
